page.title: 06RELIGION
page.content: BAPTIST CHAPEL. There is a small Baptist Chapel in the High Street in Teversham. The date above the door shows 1858, presumably this is the date of building. It is constructed of the same local brick as are the terraced cottages on each side of it. HOLYCROSS CHURCH. Leaving Teversham and onto the A 45 road going towards Cambridge one comes to the Holycross Church, C. of E., almost opposite the City cemetry. This is a modern building of red brick, built as a 'daughter' church to the Parish church of Fen Ditton. In the City cemetry, mentioned above, is a small 'Chapel' used almost exclusively for funerals.
